description: Structural and architectural use of building materials and construction assemblies.
Materials and methods of construction used in buildings, as expressed in drawings.
prerequisite: AE T 101 , EG T 101 , EG T 102

description: Layout of plumbing and fire protection in buildings to meet code and usage requirements.
Energy conservation through optimum site utilization, contours, cut and fill calculations, storm drainage, spot grading, and finish grading.
Introduction to building environmental systems technology terminology, concepts, and the design process.
Fundamental calculations and layout of systems in buildings.
Visual communication through architectural presentation drawings. Line, value, color, and composition.
Integration of materials and systems in working drawings.
Strength of materials as applied to the design of simple steel structures.
Fundamentals of design and construction of reinforced concrete structures.
Water, steam, and refrigerant systems and components; pumps and piping; heat exchangers; fluid and component selection; power and controls.
Air systems and distribution components; fans and ductwork; heat exchange coils; dampers and controls; residential fired equipment operation.
Comprehensive analysis and application of building environmental systems with focus on selected areas; calculation and layout; computer modeling of systems.
Creative projects, including research and design, that are supervised on an individual basis and that fall outside the scope of formal courses.
Formal courses given infrequently to explore, in depth, a comparatively narrow subject which may be topical or of special interest.
